textContent:
Players will have an UI tab in their menu that lets them choose between two modes of playing their character: Traveler mode and Adventurer mode (RP).

If a player wants to have an effect on the world, they will need to activate RP mode. This grants them the ability to permanently kill certain NPCs, players, affect infrastructure in the world, take important story choices and, quite importantly, IF THEY DIE THEY LOSE PROGRESSION. They can only lose progression if they are killed by another RP player. Bad RP will be punished if consistent (to prevent straight up trolling, griefing, etc...).

If the player is challenged to an honorable duel, if they are defeated the victor can choose to kill or downgrade the player (drains some maximum mana, reduces progression points, can even bargain for gear or other resources). The victor has 1 minute to decide the defeated's fate.
If one RPer kills another RPer outside of an honorable combat, the victor will gain nothing, but the defeated will still lose progression (albeit a little less).

Adventurer mode can only be activated at a certain level of progression (when the player reaches 50 ability points). The adventurer is also rewarded with better drop rates, extra ability points and some exclusive content). Dying to PvE or to a traveller will teleport them to their inn, where they will lie in a bed for a minute or so.
